page.title: 16WILD FLOWER SURVEY
page.content:
Since our area contained some common land we decided to compare the number of species of wild flowers growing on the common land with the number growing on the more intesively farmed or utilised land. The farmland is sprayed where the crops grow and the woodland is managed to rear pheasants and deer for sport. The common land is not interfered with in this way, and is a combination of woodland and rough grassland. We were not altogether surprised to find a total of 44 different varieties of flowers growing on Leckhampton Common compared with only 17 elsewhere in our area which had been treated in various ways.
SEE PAGE 17 & 18 FOR LIST OF FLOWERS.
